alert.note: Alert for Hancock; Harrison; Pearl River (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 3:04PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Harrison, eastern Hancock and northeastern Pearl River Counties through 400 PM CDT... At 304 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Poplarville to 12 miles north of Kiln to Shoreline Park. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Gulfport, Biloxi, Long Beach, Bay St. Louis, Waveland, Poplarville, Diamondhead, St. Martin, D`iberville, Kiln, Lyman, Shoreline Park, Saucier and Gulfport Airport. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 9 and 47. Interstate 59 in Mississippi between mile markers 17 and 40. Interstate 110 in Mississippi between mile markers 3 and 4. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 PM CDT for southern Mississippi.
